996003952503197697.text: It is not correct to call Efail a new vulnerability in PGP and S/MIME. The root issue has been known since 2001. The real issue is that some clients that support PGP were not aware for 17 years and did not perform the appropriate mitigation.

996452370237227009.text: Utah showed up in a major way for #NetNeutrality *again* yesterday, gathering outside @senorrinhatch's Salt Lake City office in the rain and urging him to vote 'Yes' on the CRA resolution to save the open internet!pic.twitter.com/XPxx6npEla

996149016676196354.text: New in 2.10.x development: GIMP now calculates histograms in a separate thread (or threads), which eliminates some UI freezes. A new mini framework that made this possible can be further extended to handle other similar cases. Hint: a properly filed bug report was instrumental :)

995931083584757760.text: They figured out mail clients which don't properly check for decryption errors and also follow links in HTML mails.  So the vulnerability is in the mail clients and not in the protocols.  In fact OpenPGP is immune if used correctly while S/MIME has no deployed mitigation.

1109874202381901824.text: Right now at #LibrePlanet 2019: Bryan Jones and Alison Macrina on the Library Freedom Institute, Marc Jones on the GPL, and Lori Nagel and Alex Claffey on the joy of bug reporting. Follow along on our livestream: https://libreplanet.org/2019/live/

1109873694141239298.text: Can't make it to the #LibrePlanet 2019 free software conference? We want you to participate! Follow along with the video livestream and connect with other free software enthusiasts via IRC and Mumble voice chat: https://libreplanet.org/2019/live/

1109840899012481025.text: Next at LibrePlanet 2019: "Right to Repair and the DMCA," "Meta-rules for codes of conduct," and a presentation on the Free Software Award-winning OpenStreetMap project by Kate Chapman. Follow along on the livestream! https://libreplanet.org/2019/live/

1109828128883572736.text: Next at #LibrePlanet 2019, at 10:55: "Why I forked my own project and my own company," "Building network equipment with free software and liberated hardware," and "DistrictBuilder: Free software for public mapping." Watch the livestream: https://libreplanet.org/2019/live/

1109827481576620034.text: Day one of LibrePlanet was packed with talks about important work being done in free software, and the importance of free software to the wider world. Read about it in our blog: https://www.fsf.org/blogs/community/libreplanet-day-1-trailblazing-free-software-together …

1109816441132535809.text: Congratulations to Deborah Nicholson @baconandcoconut and OpenStreetMap @openstreetmap for winning the 2018 Free Software Awards! #LibrePlanet 2019 https://www.fsf.org/news/openstreetmap-and-deborah-nicholson-win-2018-fsf-awards …

1109806983933239298.text: We're setting up for another exciting day at #LibrePlanet 2019! There's breakfast and coffee, and then Bdale Garbee will open the day with his keynote speech, "Freedom is fun!" Watch the livestream and participate on IRC: https://libreplanet.org/2019/live/

1063086350902218752.text: We don't know for sure if Apple's boot restrictions are at fault. It could just be Apple's typical practice of preinstalling nonfree software and refusing to reveal how their hardware works, causing free software for Apple hardware to often be incomplete.

1062770341028773890.text:
Apple's "secure boot" in the 2018 macbook pro is more aptly called restricted boot. It prevents GNU/Linux from accessing the laptop's ssd drive. We've been warning about these kinds of restrictions since Microsoft
initially adopted them: https://u.fsf.org/2po
